discoverArchive.title: What Was Here Before
discoverArchive.intro: The Discover menu previously featured an innovative integration that connected users to their personal Goodreads recommendations. This was not a simple API integration‚ÄîGoodreads does not provide a public API, and actively protects access to its platform, even for users accessing their own accounts.

technicalAchievement.title: The Technical Achievement
technicalAchievement.paragraph1: To overcome these limitations, we developed a sophisticated solution using Selenium-based web scraping through a dedicated plugin architecture. The most significant technical challenge was Goodreads' aggressive protection mechanisms, including CAPTCHAs designed to prevent automated access.
technicalAchievement.paragraph2b: , a state-of-the-art model for automatic speech recognition (ASR) and speech translation. After implementing traditional audio filtering and noise reduction preprocessing, we achieved an
technicalAchievement.paragraph2c: , enabling reliable automated access to user recommendations.

userFeatures.title: User Experience Features
userFeatures.intro: The integration provided users with a seamless experience to:
userFeatures.feature1: View personalized book recommendations from their own Goodreads account
userFeatures.feature2: Browse recommendations organized by genre and category
userFeatures.feature3: Mark books as read, want to read, or currently reading

screenshot.title: A Glimpse of the Interface
screenshot.description: Below is a screen capture showing an early version of the Goodreads-scraped recommendations interface. This represents the intersection of advanced machine learning, audio processing, and practical web automation to deliver value where traditional API access was unavailable.
screenshot.caption: Early version of the Goodreads recommendations integration showing personalized book suggestions

impact.title: Innovation Impact
impact.intro: This feature demonstrated our ability to:
impact.point1Detail: through creative application of cutting-edge AI technology

discoverArchive.footer: While this integration is no longer active, it represents a significant achievement in overcoming platform restrictions through innovative application of machine learning and automation technologies. The architecture and techniques developed for this feature continue to inform our approach to complex integration challenges.

whatNotToExpect.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è What Not to Expect
whatNotToExpect.speed: Production-level speed: We're serving the app unbundled using a development server
whatNotToExpect.covers: 404 error-free book cover lookup: Even though we use a "smart" component that renders a default cover with various designs when the original is not present, its current behavior is based on the original image 404ing
whatNotToExpect.code: Super clean code: This is part of a Final Project for a Vocational Training Cycle with an unrealistically low number of recommended hours. I worked quickly around the clock and had to make some trade-offs

features.title: ‚ú® Key Features
features.organization: Smart Organization: Organize your books into libraries and folders with flexible categorization
features.reader: Built-in Reader: Read EPUBs directly in your browser with Foliate.js integration
features.metadata: Metadata Management: Automatic metadata extraction using Calibre tools
features.multilang: Multi-language Support: Interface available in English, Swedish, and Spanish
features.plugins: Plugin System: Extend functionality with Docker-based plugins
features.rbac: Role-Based Access: Granular permissions system for multi-user environments

limitations.title: üîå Demo Limitations
limitations.message: This is a time-limited demo environment. Some features may be restricted or disabled. For the full experience, consider self-hosting your own instance!

getStarted.title: üöÄ Get Started
getStarted.message: Bookminder is open source and available on GitHub. You can run it on your own server using Docker, giving you complete control over your book library with no cloud dependencies.

tips.title: üí° Tips for This Demo
tips.accounts: Try both the admin and demo accounts to see different permission levels
tips.createUsers: Create new users and go through their enrollment/setup page. Log in with them (note that they're given at least Admin privileges unless you've changed the default Role during your session). Don't switch browsers when creating new users on this demo instance
tips.gutenberg: Browse the pre-loaded Project Gutenberg books in various languages
tips.reader: Test the built-in EPUB reader with any book
tips.libraries: Explore the library management and organization features
tips.plugins: Check out the plugin system in the settings, particularly if you have a traditional SMTP authentication account that allows you to send attachments. Don't worry‚Äîany personal data you provide is only stored for the duration of your session

info.contact: Questions or feedback? Feel free to reach out or check the GitHub repository for documentation and updates.
